description.narrative: The Samoa Agribusiness Support Project (SABP) aims to improve access to finance for selected agribusiness enterprise to lessen the shortage of capital in the sector and enable bank lending and to provide business support facilities to partner companies to boost their capacity limitations and improve access to markets, including improving raw material supply chains. SABP works with Samoa’s four commercial banks (ANZ Bank, BSP Bank, National Bank of Samoa and Samoa Commercial Bank). SABP provides cash collateral to secure up to 50 percent of the amount commercial banks lend to eligible agribusiness borrowers for first-time loans and 30 percent for second-time loans. Each dollar of collateral will leverage twice the amount of bank lending. This contributes to an overall lower interest rate for the agribusinesses. SABP also provides repayable supplemental seed capital injections of 25 percent of the borrowers’ total project costs to improve the borrowers’ equity position if they are determ
